intro: Angraecum dollii, commonly known as the Madagascar star orchid, is a rare and striking epiphytic orchid native to Madagascar. It features long, narrow leaves and produces fragrant, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom at night. The plant is notable for its unique floral structure, which includes a long, slender spur that holds nectar. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific conditions to flower successfully. Due to its rarity and beauty, it is highly sought after by orchid enthusiasts and conservationists alike.
